content.description: Stunning face climbing through crimps, pockets, and a crack feature. Start matched on flake, or use low left crimp (as GW on the FA). Punchy moves up high make for a full value experience.
content.protection: A few big pads soothe the mind. Falls are generally straight.
content.location: Boulder northwest and downhill from Cobra khan, on the way to #tall.

content.description: Start on edge and sick three finger pocket. Make powerful moves up and left with less than ideal feet. Movement is great, if only the rock quality was a bit better.
content.location: Facing pockadoodle go down left under the boulder. Turn left and it’s there, on the boulder pockadoodle is leaning against

content.description:
Start standing with your left hand on a small crimp sidepull and your right in a vertical slot/pocket, both at 6 feet. Climb the beautiful face via pockets and crimps to an easy top out.

This line climbs some of the best rock in Joe's Valley and has interesting and fun movement. Definitely easier than v5.
content.location: The climb is on one of the first boulders you encounter when hiking up the hill. You will see a large prominent arete (currently a project). This problem is behind and to the left of that problem, in a small alcove. It is on the left side of the face.

content.description:
The Minimalist is located on the southwest overhang of the Zero Boulder.  As the name suggests, the very minimal starting hand and foot holds make this a powerful and steep encounter.

Pull off the ground via the poor V shaped hold at chest height and a faint dimple down low for a left foot.  Slap the sloping (but surprisingly good) lip and fight the swing to grab an incut crimp out right.  Establish here and continue out right to good holds and an airy mantle.
content.protection: A few pads and a good spot.
content.location: The Zero Boulder can be found halfway up the steep hillside, passing the Twilight Zone and Skeleton Key on your way.  It is the last block identified in the new Joe's guide.

content.description: Start with matched hands on undercling rail. Follow the snakey tufa to a difficult topout.
content.location: Cross the river, head up canyon into a small meadow, then find a series of trails heading up the hill. 15 min hike to Cobra Con. The boulder is almost directly perpendicular from the big arch formation across the road.
